posts.post_content: [Virulent Swipe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Virulent Swipe) makes for a mean 5/2 attacker that costs the opponent at least two cards. I quite like this guy in G/B, I bet [rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=rancor) would make him insanely scary, given that trample + deathtouch means blocking is nigh pointless.
posts.html:
Virulent Swipe makes for a mean 5/2 attacker that costs the opponent at least two cards. I quite like this guy in G/B, I bet rancor would make him insanely scary, given that trample + deathtouch means blocking is nigh pointless.

posts.post_content:
"*Only weakness is that black has few support spells.*"-- Sel3l3e  
  
Remember that aside from Insants and Sorceries, Auras will trigger Heroic as well.  
And don't forget even creatures with Bestow can turn into Auras to trigger his effect.  
I'm sure Theros, being an Enchantment-based cycle, will probably have provided us with a great amount of Heroic triggers in any color once it's complete.  
  
Also, just because the mana cost of this card is double black doesn't mean you're not allowed to add another color to your deck for the support spells you like ;)
posts.html:
"Only weakness is that black has few support spells."-- Sel3l3e

Remember that aside from Insants and Sorceries, Auras will trigger Heroic as well.
And don't forget even creatures with Bestow can turn into Auras to trigger his effect.
I'm sure Theros, being an Enchantment-based cycle, will probably have provided us with a great amount of Heroic triggers in any color once it's complete.

Also, just because the mana cost of this card is double black doesn't mean you're not allowed to add another color to your deck for the support spells you like ;)

Posted By: Mode (9/17/2013 5:51:03 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Seems pretty perfect in anything that has plenty of means of targeting this guy with spells. Putting [Madcap Skills](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Madcap Skills) on him or casting [Armed](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Armed) and/or [Dangerous](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dangerous) targeting him seems like it'd have good results.   
  
A fused Armed // Dangerous on this guy can really wreck an opponent - they sac a creature, then deathtouch takes care of the rest.
posts.html:

A fused Armed // Dangerous on this guy can really wreck an opponent - they sac a creature, then deathtouch takes care of the rest.

Posted By: SyntheticDreamer (9/17/2013 6:32:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Sel3l3e: I disagree with "few support spells." In a deck that takes advantage of this guy and Heroic, you've got a disgusting machine at your disposal. For example:  
  
In color: [Boon of Erebos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Boon of Erebos), [Scourgemark](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Scourgemark), [Ordeal of Erebos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ordeal of Erebos). Even if they kill him in response to any of these spells, you're still at card parity and hopefully took something good out. It may not work as well against tokens but it works very well against hexproof and indestructibles.  
  
Allied colors: [Fate Foretold](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fate Foretold), and [Aqueous Form](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Aqueous Form), [Ordeal of Porphorus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ordeal of Porphorus). Outside of Theros, we have [Madcap Skills](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Madcap Skills) and, my personal favorite, [Hidden Strings](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hidden Strings). Yeah, that's right, repeatable destruction and evasion with a two card combo that *keeps you at card parity*.  
  
Now, if you build a deck with other Heroics, well, the value just gets even crazier. [Labyrinth Champion](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Labyrinth Champion)... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@Sel3l3e: I disagree with "few support spells." In a deck that takes advantage of this guy and Heroic, you've got a disgusting machine at your disposal. For example:

In color: Boon of Erebos, Scourgemark, Ordeal of Erebos. Even if they kill him in response to any of these spells, you're still at card parity and hopefully took something good out. It may not work as well against tokens but it works very well against hexproof and indestructibles.

Allied colors: Fate Foretold, and Aqueous Form, Ordeal of Porphorus. Outside of Theros, we have Madcap Skills and, my personal favorite, Hidden Strings. Yeah, that's right, repeatable destruction and evasion with a two card combo that keeps you at card parity.

Now, if you build a deck with other Heroics, well, the value just gets even crazier. Labyrinth Champion... (see all)
